abstract: In testimony prepared for a Senate Banking Committee hearing on Wednesday, Jamie Dimon sounded a note of contrition, but also emphasized the strength of the bank.
snippet: In testimony prepared for a Senate Banking Committee hearing on Wednesday, Jamie Dimon sounded a note of contrition, but also emphasized the strength of the bank.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, plans to tell lawmakers on Wednesday that a trading blunder that could result in losses as high as $5 billion was “an isolated event.”

headline.main: JPMorgan Chief Says Huge Trading Loss Was ‘Isolated Event’

abstract: The prepared remarks of the JPMorgan chief raise more questions about the bank’s billion-dollar trading blunder than they answer.
snippet: The prepared remarks of the JPMorgan chief raise more questions about the bank’s billion-dollar trading blunder than they answer.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase‘s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, has said a little more about the botched derivatives trade that has led to billions of dollars of losses at the bank. The new utterances, contained in prepared testimony he will give to members of Congress on Wednesday, will likely raise more questions about the trade than they answer.
